Class Subwindow

java.lang.Object
com.tablr.subwindow.Subwindow
Direct Known Subclasses:
DesignSubwindow, FormSubwindow, RowsSubwindow, TablesSubwindow
public abstract class Subwindow extends Object
Represents an abstract subwindow in the application. Provides common functionality for managing subwindow behavior, such as dragging, resizing, and rendering.

  • Constructor Details

    • Subwindow

      public Subwindow(String title, int x, int y, int width, int height, SubwindowController parentWindow)
      Constructs a Subwindow instance with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the subwindow.
      x - The x-coordinate of the subwindow.
      y - The y-coordinate of the subwindow.
      width - The width of the subwindow.
      height - The height of the subwindow.
      parentWindow - The parent controller managing this subwindow.

      Retrieves height of subwindow.
      Returns:

    • updateTableArea

      public abstract void updateTableArea()
      Updates the table area associated with the subwindow. This method must be implemented by subclasses.

    • getTableId

      public abstract int getTableId()
      Retrieves the ID of the table associated with the subwindow.
      Returns:
      The table ID.

    • updateTableAreaPositions

      protected void updateTableAreaPositions()
      Updates the position of the table area within the subwindow.

    • myStringToInt

      protected Integer myStringToInt(String string)
      Converts a string to an Integer.
      Parameters:
      string - The string to convert.
      Returns:
      The Integer value, or null if the string is null or empty.

    • isIntString

      protected boolean isIntString(String str)
      Checks if a string represents a valid integer.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to check.
      Returns:
      True if the string is a valid integer or empty, false otherwise.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws the subwindow, including its frame, title bar, content, resize handle and scrollbars.
      Parameters:
      g - The Graphics object used for rendering.

    • drawContent

      protected void drawContent(Graphics g)
      Draws the content of the subwindow. This method must be implemented by subclasses.
      Parameters:
      g - The Graphics object used for rendering.

    • isInside

      public boolean isInside(int mx, int my)
      Checks if a point is inside the subwindow.
      Parameters:
      mx - The x-coordinate of the point.
      my - The y-coordinate of the point.
      Returns:
      True if the point is inside the subwindow, false otherwise.

    • isInsideTitleBar

      public boolean isInsideTitleBar(int mx, int my)
      Checks if a point is inside the title bar of the subwindow.
      Parameters:
      mx - The x-coordinate of the point.
      my - The y-coordinate of the point.
      Returns:
      True if the point is inside the title bar, false otherwise.

    • isClickOnClose

      public boolean isClickOnClose(int mx, int my)
      Checks if a point is on the close button of the subwindow.
      Parameters:
      mx - The x-coordinate of the point.
      my - The y-coordinate of the point.
      Returns:
      True if the point is on the close button, false otherwise.

    • setFocused

      public void setFocused(boolean isFocused)
      Sets the focus state of the subwindow.
      Parameters:
      isFocused - True to focus the subwindow, false to unfocus it.

    • isFocused

      public boolean isFocused()
      Checks if the subwindow is focused.
      Returns:
      True if the subwindow is focused, false otherwise.

      public abstract void onBodyClick(int x, int y)
      Handles click events within the body of the subwindow. This method must be implemented by subclasses.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the click.
      y - The y-coordinate of the click.

      y - The y-coordinate of the double click.
